customer_addr:
1768 Sweet Home Road
Broken Bow, OK 74728

citations.narrative:
There was an area in the facility where the public was potentially able to make contact with the enclosed animals without
attendants present.
-A group of whitetail deer in the front yard area have no public barrier to prevent being approached and contacted by
members of the public.
-A male kangaroo in the front yard had a barrier around most of the enclosure, but the gate to the enclosure was left
open, and the kangaroo was loose in the yard area with no facility attendant present.
-The gate to the goat and sheep enclosure was left open, and the goat and sheep were loose in the yard with no
attendant present.
All regulated animals must be protected from public contact unless facility attendants are present and observing guest
interactions. The facility must ensure that all animals have appropriate public barriers, or that all animals are being
properly observed by easily identifiable attendants.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
In an outdoor enclosure for six game fowl, there was an excessive accumulation of a dried white and gray waste material
on top of the two shelter boxes. There was also a heavy accumulation of dried waste on a wooden swing over one
shelter. Excreta must be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulations.
Failure to clean accumulations of waste materials can increase disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors. The licensee
must ensure animal enclosures are kept clean to prevent accumulations of waste at all times.
Corrected at time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.131(d)(2)  Repeat
   
Handling of animals. 
There was an area in the facility where the public was potentially able to make contact with the enclosed animals without 
attendants present. 
-A group of whitetail deer in the front yard area have no public barrier to prevent being approached and contacted by 
members of the public. 
-A male kangaroo in the front yard had a barrier around most of the enclosure, but the gate to the enclosure was left 
open, and the kangaroo was loose in the yard area with no facility attendant present. 
-The gate to the goat and sheep enclosure was left open, and the goat and sheep were loose in the yard with no 
attendant present. 
All regulated animals must be protected from public contact unless facility attendants are present and observing guest 
interactions. The facility must ensure that all animals have appropriate public barriers, or that all animals are being 
properly observed by easily identifiable attendants. 
3.158(a)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
In an outdoor enclosure for six game fowl, there was an excessive accumulation of a dried white and gray waste material 
on top of the two shelter boxes. There was also a heavy accumulation of dried waste on a wooden swing over one 
shelter. Excreta must be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulations. 
Failure to clean accumulations of waste materials can increase disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors. The licensee 
must ensure animal enclosures are kept clean to prevent accumulations of waste at all times. 
 
Corrected at time of inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

Additional Inspectors: 
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
